conclusion: The graph shown represents the v-t (velocity-time) graph of a particle moving in a straight line, and the graph is symmetric about the dashed line in the figure.
The particle passes through a certain position three times within the time interval 0 to t1.
This implies that the particle has reversed its direction of motion at least once during this interval.
The possible scenarios of its motion are:

Scenario 1: The particle starts moving in one direction, reaches a certain position, reverses its direction, returns to the starting point, and then moves in the opposite direction to reach the same position again.

Scenario 2: The particle starts moving in one direction, reaches a certain position, reverses its direction, and then moves back to the same position again before reversing its direction once more to reach the same position for the third time.
In both scenarios, the particle's velocity changes direction at least once, indicating a change in the direction of motion.
